alert.note: Alert for Westmoreland (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 27 at 2:46PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...Thunderstorms will impact portions of central Dorchester, northwestern Northumberland, central Richmond and southeastern Westmoreland Counties through 345 PM EDT... At 245 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking scattered thunderstorms along a line extending from 7 miles east of Taylors Island to near Saint Inigoes Creek to near Warsaw. Movement was northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. Rainfall 1 to 2 inches. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Heavy rainfall may cause minor flooding of low lying and poor drainage areas. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Lewisetta around 310 PM EDT. Secretary around 315 PM EDT. Hurlock around 320 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by these storms include Lottsburg, Threeway, Andrews, Hoopersville, Crocheron, Church Creek, Wingate, Oldhams, Woolford and Westmoreland. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
